result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesus Campos was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carrying A Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber privileges for work and treatment.

miscConds.notes:
No new laws rising to the level of probable cause.
No use or possession of firearms.
Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.,  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Breathalyzer and drug testing.

Mental health assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment.
Complete a cognitive thinking program.
Complete a firearms safety course.  Court will allow defendant to use a weapon for the purpose of class only.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay applicable surcharge.
Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
Court waives all nonmandatory costs, fees and surcharges.

charges.descr: Endangering Safety By Use Of Dangerous Weapon (Under  The Influence Of Intoxicant)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesus Campos

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jesus Campos in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant ordered to serve 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction, credit of 0 days time served, Huber Privileges for work  and treatment.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:

- No new laws rising to the level of probable cause.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.  Breatalyzer and drug testing.
- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Mental health assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Complete a cognitive thinking program.
- No use of possession of firearms.
- Complete a firearms safety course.  Court will allow defendant to use a weapon for the purpose of class only.
- Court ordered Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay applicable surcharge. 
- Court WAIVES all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges.  Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

*** Court DENIES expungement request.

Court advised Defendant of his/her right to seek post conviction relief.

Defendant Jesus Campos in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank. 

AS TO COUNT 2: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders charge dismissed but read-in for sentencing purposes.
Received and Filed. Defendant's Guilty Plea Questionnaire
Received and Filed. State's Accepted Offer
Received and Filed. Post Conviction Motion Advisement
Received and Filed. Elements: Carrying Concealed Weapon

Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Scheduling Conference.
DEFENDANT FIALED TO APPEAR. Defense advises the  court he spoke to defendant on 7-4-2022 and provided him the zoom information.
Defense request a resolution date. Court advises defense if defendant fails to appear at the next court date a Bench Warrant will be Issued.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Jesus Campos in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST.Case in court for Pretrial Conference.  
Discussion held off the record. Defense counsel recently appointed and awaiting discovery and offer in this case.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.This hearing will be be held streamed Live through dacast- via Zoom.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jesus Campos in court.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 19 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
